title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Dined with Directors, of whom I only knew the Manager, Sutherland Mackenzie, Sir David Milne, and Wauchope, besides one or two old Oil Gas friends.

title: The works of Robert Burns: with an account of his life, and criticism on his writings.

snippet: much I was gratified with the countenance and approbation of one of my country's most illustrious  sons, when Mr. Wauchope called on me y-sterday on the part of your Lordship.

title: The works of Robert Burns: with an account of his life, and criticism on his writings.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: In the course of this tour he visited Mr, Ainslie of Berrywell, the father of hia companion ; Mr. Brydone, the celebrated traveller, to whom he carried a' letter of introduction from Mr. Mackenzie ; the Rev. Dr. Sommerville, of Jedburgh, the historian ; Mr. and Mrs. Scott, of Wauchope ; Dr. Elhot, a phvsician, retired to a romantic spot on tins banks of the Roole ; Sir Alexander Don ; Sir James Hall, of Dunglass; and a great variety of other respectable  characters.

title: The works of Robert Burns: with an account of his life, and criticism on his writings.
author: Burns, Robert

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: In a poetical epistle addressed to •' Mrs. Scott, of Wauchope house," dated March, 1787, he alludes to the sensations of his early days in the following tender strain of sentiment.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: It is easy then to guess how much I was gratified with the countenance and approbation of one of my country's most il- lustrioxis sons, when Mr. Wauchope called on me yesterday on the part of your lordship.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Wauchope, in Roxburgshire — a lady of taste and talent, and fitted to use the pencil as well as the pen — had addressed (February 1787) the lines, printed in small type, to Burns, which called forth the ensuing verses, as a reply or acknowledgment.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Mrs. Fall, a genius in painting; fully more clever in the fine arts and sciences than my friend Lady Wauchope, without her consummate

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Wauchope — Mr. Scott exactly the figure and face commonly given to Sancho Panca — very shrewd in his farming matters, and not unfrequently  stumbles on what may be called a strong thing rather than a good thing.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Set out next morning for Wauchope, the seat of my correspondent, Mrs. Scott — breakfast by the way Avith Dr. Elliot, an agreeable, goodhearted,  climate-beaten old veteran, in the medical line ; now retired to a romantic, but rather moorish place, on the banks of the Roole — he accompanies us almost to Wauchope — we traverse the country to the top of Bochester, the scene of an old encampment, and Woolee Hill.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
